solution_line_template: Boys make up {total_percentage_val}% - {girls_percentage_val}% = {boys_percentage_val}% of the total number of students.

The total number of students at the school is {number_of_boys} / ({boys_percentage_val}/{percentage_denominator}) = <<{number_of_boys}/({boys_percentage_val}/{percentage_denominator})={total_students}>>{total_students} students.

Since 60% of the students are female, there are ({girls_percentage_val}/{percentage_denominator}) * {total_students} = <<{girls_percentage_val}/{percentage_denominator}*{total_students}={number_of_girls}>>{number_of_girls} female students.
